intro: Datisca hirta, commonly known as the hairy datisca, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squashes, though it is not closely related to them. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are hairy and lobed. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in arid environments. The hairy datisca is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
